solution: Since the angles along a straight line add to $180^\circ$, then $x^\circ+40^\circ=180^\circ$ or $x+40=180$ or $x=\boxed{140}$.
model_solution:
Since the angles at $B$ form a straight line, $x + 40 = 180.$
Subtract 40 from both sides of the equation $x + 40 = 180.$
Subtract $x$ from both sides of the equation $x+40=110$. Final Answer
